description:
The route of a tiny hidden stream offers the opportunity for a walk through 2000 years of London’s development. 

Walk from Shoreditch to the Thames, taking in landmarks & buildings that span the history of The City.

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs: Walbrook was a fresh water source that fed the Roman City of London, and perhaps the first of London’s “Lost Rivers” to be buried beneath the streets and buildings of the expanding metropolis.

factsheet.heading: Context
paragraphs: The ING Media team has been walking the Walbrook as way of introducing new team members to the City of London’s built environment since discovering a possible branch of the stream in a nearby backstreet.

name: Walbrook River Walk
